intro: Sterculia pallens, commonly known as the white sterculia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has smooth, grey-green leaves and produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils and is often found in coastal forests and woodlands. The flowers attract pollinators such as birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance.
